body.p: A Kentucky attorney and politician. Educated in Jessamine County, Kentucky and Hancock County, Illinois. Admitted to the bar and practiced in Paducah, Kentucky and Henderson, Kentucky. Married twice, first to America Smedley Crockett and a second time to Louisa M. Ingram Crockett. Father of John W. Crockett, III, Lucy Crockett Thornberry, and Wyatt Ingram Crockett. Represented the Second Congressional District of Kentucky at the Southern Rights Convention in 1861. Represented Kentucky at the Border Slave State Conference in 1861. Served as a delegate to the Russellville Convention in 1861. Served as a member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Served the Second Congressional District as a member of the First Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1862 to 1864. Returned to Henderson, Kentucky to practice law.
